Postfix Quota

Postfix Quota checks postfix maildirs. It will send warning emails to the owner of the current account, if the size of the account is over the warning limit. It will delete some mails, if the size of the folder is over the quota limit. The owner of the current account will informed by email.

Enabled (postfix admin will get the report "Which will happen")
Postfix Test
Postfix tests the sending of an email to the postfix admin. It is a service for development only.
Please enter an email adress.
Please enter the path to the folder with the email drafts (with an ending slash). Default: typo3conf/ext/postfix/lib/scheduler/maildrafts/

CAUTION: Postfix Quota will remove emails!"

Postfix Quota mode is "Warnings and removing emails"

Postfix Quota will

  • send a warning email to the owner of a mailbox and a copy to the Postfix administrator, if warning limit is overrun and
  • will remove e-mails in the mailbox, if the quota limit is overrun. Owner and administrator will informed of course.

To let remove emails automatically is a very high-risk! If you have an unproper configuration like a quota of 0 megabyte, all emails of all mailboxes will removed! You won\'t have any chance to cancel it.

If you aren't strong-willed to use Postfix Quota in this mode:

  • Please remove this task directly!
  • Check your configuration in mode "Report (test mode)".
  • Use Postfix Quota in mode "Warnings" for a time.

You are using TYPO3 and TYPO3 Postfix without any warranty!

Postfix Quota will warn mailbox owner"

Warn mails, if a mailbox overrun the warning limit.

Postfix Quota will

  • send a warning email to the owner of a mailbox and a copy to the Postfix administrator, if warning limit is overrun.

Nothing more won\'t happen.

Postfix Quota sends a report only

The Postfix administrator will get a report by email about what will happen in

  • Postfix Quota mode "Warnings"
  • Postfix Quota mode "Warnings and removing emails"
